intro: Baeothryon tenuiculum, commonly known as the slender beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Baeothryon tenuiculum is an important plant for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
